title: Typograpic trailer
content:
Watch this trailer...   
   
 [http://oceans12.warnerbros.com/flash.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022211440/http:/oceans12.warnerbros.com/flash.html)   
   
..discuss.   
   
I love all the transitions...very smooth.   
   
I always liked the [first poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022211440/http:/www.justwatchthesky.com/g/extras/oceans-eleven-promo.jpg). I don't think the new poster is quite as strong, but it's still a refreshing change from the usual batch of headshots + type.
author: flow14

comments.content:
I really like that, its interesting not seeing a trailer without any scenes from the actual movie for a change. The transitions were really nice and the rework on the WB logo to match the preview looked good. The coordination with the music is also nice.   
   
This is kind of good for inspiration for me at the moment as I have recently started fooling around with after effects.

I really liked the first poster, too..   
And, the trailer is very, very nice..   
Thanks for posting it..

Finally, a trailer that doesn't start with "In a world..."   
   
That poster was inspired by the [_Smithereens' 11_ album cover](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022211440/http:/images.amazon.com/images/P/B000006N4U.01.LZZZZZZZ.jpg). That, in turn, was inspired by [this book](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022211440/http:/www.deandaviswrotethat.com/oceans11.jpg). Funny how things come full circle.

_Finally, a trailer that doesn't start with "In a world..."_   
   
 [Which reminds me of this.](http://web.archive.org/web/20131022211440/http:/www.apple.com/trailers/miramax/comedian.html)   
   
I thought the trailer was pretty nice, too. Motion graphics looks like so much fun. I wonder if it really is? I have After Effects and have used it a bit, but haven't done enough of it to tell.

mmmm, I remember seeing this in theatres, much more impressive on a large scale.   
   
It would be nice if they _don't_ make a longer trailer. Too many trailers completly give away the movies...

Don't you think that they can get away with a trailer sans footage or faces because the faces are so known?   
   
I liked it thought, a lot.
